title: Anton Winkler
text:
Anton Winkler (23 February 1954 – 8 October 2016) was a <a href="West%20Germany">West German</a> <a href="luge">luge</a>r who competed during the late 1970s and early 1980s. He won the bronze medal in the men's singles event at the <a href="1980%20Winter%20Olympics">1980 Winter Olympics</a> in <a href="Lake%20Placid%2C%20New%20York">Lake Placid, New York</a>.
Winkler also won three medals at the <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships">FIL World Luge Championships</a> with a silver (singles: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201978">1978</a>) and two bronzes (singles: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201977">1977</a>, doubles: <a href="FIL%20World%20Luge%20Championships%201979">1979</a>). Additionally, he won a gold medal in the men's singles event at the <a href="FIL%20European%20Luge%20Championships%201977">1977 FIL European Luge Championships</a> in <a href="Sch%C3%B6nau%20am%20K%C3%B6nigsee">Königssee</a>, <a href="West%20Germany">West Germany</a>. Winkler was the first men's singles <a href="List%20of%20Luge%20World%20Cup%20champions">Luge World Cup</a> overall champion in 1977-78.
Winkler died on 8 October 2016.
